title: STRchive-loci
citation_format: In text: [@pmid:20560987; @pmid:26220009], individual citations in a list: [pmid:20560987, pmid:26220009]

chrom.description: Chromosome name, assumed to be the same for all reference genomes

start_hg38.description: Start position in hg38 reference genome

stop_hg38.description: Stop position in hg38 reference genome

start_hg19.description: Start position in hg19 reference genome

stop_hg19.description: Stop position in hg19 reference genome

start_t2t.description: Start position in chm13-T2T reference genome

stop_t2t.description: Stop position in chm13-T2T reference genome

id.description: Unique identifier for the locus within STRchive in the form [disease_id]_[gene] e.g. CANVAS_RFC1

gene_strand.description: Direction of gene transcription relative to reference genome e.g. + or -

reference_motif_reference_orientation.description: Motif in the reference genome in the + reference orientation (regardless of if it is pathogenic) e.g. AAAAG

pathogenic_motif_reference_orientation.description: Pathogenic motif(s) in the + reference orientation e.g. AAGGG,ACAGG

pathogenic_motif_gene_orientation.description: Pathogenic motif(s) in the gene orientation, so the reverse complement if gene is on - strand e.g. CCCTT,CCTGT

benign_motif_reference_orientation.description: Pathogenic motif(s) in the + reference orientation e.g. AAAAG

disease.description: Disease name in words e.g. Cerebellar ataxia, neuropathy, and vestibular areflexia syndrome

flank_motif.description: Structure of the locus with any flanking motifs. The pathogenic locus should be indicated with n copies. For example (CAG)nCAACAG(CCG)12

locus_structure.description: Structure of the locus including the order of motifs and any interruptions e.g. (CAG)*CAACAG(CCG)*

inheritance.description: Inheritance pattern(s) of the disease e.g. AD for autosomal dominant

location_in_gene.description: Location of the repeat locus in the gene e.g. Intron 2

benign_min.description: Minimum number of repeats in the benign (normal) range

benign_max.description: Maximum number of repeats in the benign (normal) range. Must be >= benign_min

intermediate_min.description: Minimum number of repeats in the intermediate range

intermediate_max.description: Maximum number of repeats in the intermediate range. Must be >= intermediate_min

pathogenic_min.description: Minimum number of repeats in the pathogenic range

pathogenic_max.description: Maximum number of repeats in the pathogenic range. Must be >= pathogenic_min

ref_copies.description: Number of motif copies in the reference genome

motif_len.description: Length of the motif in base pairs

age_onset.description: Description of the age of onset of the disease with citations

age_onset_min.description: Minimum age of onset reported in the literatre (years)

age_onset_max.description: Maximum age of onset reported in the literatre (years). Must be >= age_onset_min

typ_age_onset_min.description: Minimum of the typical age of onset range reported in the literatre (years)

typ_age_onset_max.description: Maximum of the typical age of onset range reported in the literatre (years). Must be >= typ_age_onset_min

novel.description: If the pathogenic motif is in the reference genome, ref, otherwise, novel

mechanism.description: Brief/categorical mechanism of disease e.g. LoF

mechanism_detail.description: Detailed mechanism of disease with citations e.g. Loss of function [pmid:38467784]

source.description: Source of the data. NOTE: this field may be removed in the future

details.description: Detailed information about the locus and evidence for pathogenicity, with citations in the format [pmid:38467784]

prevalence.description: Prevalence of the disease as a fraction

prevalence_details.description: Details about the prevalence of the disease including affected populations and citations in the format [pmid:38467784]

stripy.description: STRIpy ID(s) for the disease, typically the gene ID

gnomad.description: gnomAD ID(s) for the gene, typically the gene ID

year.description: Year of first publication of the tandem repeat disease locus with citations

webstr_hg38.description: WebSTR ID(s) for the locus in hg38

webstr_hg19.description: WebSTR ID(s) for the locus in hg19

tr_atlas.description: Tandem Repeat Atlas ID(s) for the locus

disease_description.description: Description of the disease with citations
examples: Sensory disturbances, imbalance, oscillopsia, chronic dry cough, dysarthria and dysphagia [pmid:38876750]

locus_tags.description: Tags for the locus, used for grouping similar loci and for flagging loci with specific characteristics

disease_tags.description: Tags for the disease, used for grouping similar diseases

references.description: All references from the fields above in the format. Automatically generated.

additional_literature.description: Additional literature related to this locus in the format. Should not be included in the references field. Automatically generated.
